meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fiendish.
meanings.sent1: Her fiendishness was evident in the way she plotted against her friends.
meanings.sent2: The fiendishness of the villain's plan was truly terrifying.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fiendishness, he always had a mischievous twinkle in his eye.
meanings.sent4: The fiendishness of the puzzle left us scratching our heads in confusion.
meanings.sent5: The fiendishness of the maze made it nearly impossible to escape.

meanings.definition: The behavior or actions characteristic of a fiend.
meanings.sent1: His fiendishness was on full display when he scared his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fiendishness was evident as it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent3: The fiendishness of the squirrel stealing birdseed was both annoying and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fiendishness of the raccoon raiding the trash cans was a nightly occurrence.
meanings.sent5: The fiendishness of the dog stealing socks made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: The state of being extremely wicked or cruel.
meanings.sent1: The fiendishness of the dictator's rule caused suffering for many.
meanings.sent2: The fiendishness of the witch's curse haunted the village for years.
meanings.sent3: The fiendishness of the prank was all in good fun, despite the mess it caused.
meanings.sent4: The fiendishness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The fiendishness of the dragon's gaze struck fear into the hearts of all who beheld it.
